guide.introduction: I enjoy just about any kind of woodworking, so I decided to make the wooden stand for my Giant Bubble Machine project instead of just buying one.
guide.introduction_rendered:
I enjoy just about any kind of woodworking, so I decided to make the wooden stand for my Giant Bubble Machine project instead of just buying one.

Relevant parts
  • 1×2 lumber (nominal), 3'
  • Wood screws
  • Hinge
  • Wood screws
  • Wood glue
Tools
  • Clamp or large clip
  • Saw
  • Screwdriver

lines.text: Screw and glue together two 3-feet long sticks into an uneven X shape, making the cross at about 3/4 of the length.
lines.text_raw: Screw and glue together two 3-feet long sticks into an uneven X shape, making the cross at about 3/4 of the length.

lines.text: Now do another pair. Make sure the two Xs come out as identical as possible to one another, for maximum stability.
lines.text_raw: Now do another pair. Make sure the two Xs come out as identical as possible to one another, for maximum stability.

lines.text: Don’t worry about excess wood. You can trim it off later.
lines.text_raw: Don’t worry about excess wood. You can trim it off later.

lines.text: Connect the two Xs with a horizontal stick, using both screws and glue.
lines.text_raw: Connect the two Xs with a horizontal stick, using both screws and glue.

lines.text: Leave an extra 4-5" sticking from one side, for the kit box housing the Arduino.
lines.text_raw: Leave an extra 4-5" sticking from one side, for the kit box housing the Arduino.

lines.text: That's it!  Now you're ready to dress it up (I used pool noodles) and add the giant bubble blowing workings.  See MAKE vol. 28 for complete plans.

guide.summary: Build the wooden frame for the Giant Bubble Machine, as an alternative to using a store-bought sawhorse or folding stand.
